summary:
After all the Wordpress drama this week I tooted the following:

We really need a new, easy to use, CMS written in PHP to compete with Wordpress. 


Why PHP.  Because you dump files on a server, any server, and it just works...
title: Alternatives to Wordpress

summary: I'm five hours from home, holed up in a mountain cabin with an ultrarunning grandma getting ready to race 100 miles
title: Hurricanes and Pre-Race Jitters

summary:
NIST’s second draft of its “SP 800-63-4“—its digital identify guidelines—finally contains some really good rules about passwords:
The following requirements apply to passwords:

lVerifiers and CSPs SHALL require passwords to be a minimum of eight characters in length and SHOULD require passwords to be a minimum of 15 characters in length. 
Verifiers and CSPs SHOULD permit a maximum password length of at least 64 characters. 
Verifiers and CSPs SHOULD accept all printing ASCII [RFC20] characters and the space character in passwords...
title: NIST Recommends Some Common-Sense Password Rules

title: The Other Bubble

summary:
This morning, I think I somehow signed up to do Inktober2024 after reading Darren Hester's post.  He was asking if anyone over on Mastodon would be doing the yearly challenge and, yes, like I always do, I talked myself into doing a whole 31 days of scribbling, eh, I mean serious artwork. 
Well, they will probably be doodles for me...
title: Inktober 2024
